result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jasma Shanette Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jasma Shanette Jackson in court.  
Attorney Amanda Poznanski for Fred Richardson III in court for Jasma Shanette Jackson.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discover and waiting for Lab Results.. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jasma Shanette Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Jasma Shanette Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #14CF4536.  Sworn for the State: MCSO Detective T. Rosenstein. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jasma Shanette Jackson in court with Attorney Fred Richardson, both appear by video.   Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini appears in person under the supervision of Attorney Karine O'Byrne who appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Richardson is unable to appear due to COVID exposure. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jasma Shanette Jackson in court, appear by video with attorney Fred Richardson, appear in person.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appear in person with Student Intern Carline Pellegrini appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant recently had surgery. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jasma Shanette Jackson in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
